DOC.brief_title: N-GAL Allows Intensive Treatment Contrast Induced Nephropathy
DOC.detailed_description: Background Patients undergo urgent/emergency coronary angiography receive preventive treatment contrast induce nephropathy . An acute kidney injury generally detect late allow effective intervention patient undergo urgent/emergency coronary angiography . Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) new biomarker predictive AKI already show useful early diagnosis contrast induce nephropathy . Purpose The primary objective study test hypothesis NGAL-driven early intensive strategy reduce occurrence contrast induce nephropathy patient urgent/emergency coronary angiography
DOC.criteria: Indication urgent/emergency coronary angiography Normal renal function ( eGFR > 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 ) Moderate high Mehran 's risk score CIN ( > 11 ) .
